DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication whether or not the specimen was submitted to the Patient-Derived Models Repository (PDMR).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Domain Patient-Derived Models Repository Biospecimen Submission
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information._A national repository comprised of patient-derived xenografts (PDX), in vitro patient-derived tumor cell cultures (PDC) and cancer associated fibroblasts (CAF) as well as patient-derived organoids (PDOrg). These models will serve as a resource for public-private partnerships and for academic drug discovery efforts. These materials will be clinically annotated with molecular information available in an easily accessible database and will be available to the extramural community._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information.

Concepts.definition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information.

Property.preferredDefinition:
A national repository comprised of patient-derived xenografts (PDX), in vitro patient-derived tumor cell cultures (PDC) and cancer associated fibroblasts (CAF) as well as patient-derived organoids (PDOrg). These models will serve as a resource for public-private partnerships and for academic drug discovery efforts. These materials will be clinically annotated with molecular information available in an easily accessible database and will be available to the extramural community.

:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

Concepts.definition: A national repository comprised of patient-derived xenografts (PDX), in vitro patient-derived tumor cell cultures (PDC) and cancer associated fibroblasts (CAF) as well as patient-derived organoids (PDOrg). These models will serve as a resource for public-private partnerships and for academic drug discovery efforts. These materials will be clinically annotated with molecular information available in an easily accessible database and will be available to the extramural community.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
